snippet.title: Conflict without Misperceptions or Incomplete Information: How the Future Matters
snippet.description: Conflict and war are typically viewed as the outcome of misperceptions, incomplete information, or even irrationality. The authors show that it can be otherwise. Despite the short-run incentives to settle disputes peacefully, there can be long-term, compounding rewards to going to war when doing better relative to one's opponent today implies doing better tomorrow. snippet.title: Democracy and Development in Mali
snippet.description: Mali, a country rich with history and culture, but one of the poorest in the world, emerged in the 1990s as one of Africa's most vibrant democracies. Strengthened by bold political and economic reforms at home, Mali has emerged as a leader in African peace keeping efforts. How has such a transition taken place? snippet.description: Cet article se fonde sur un sondage d'opinion de l'Afrobaromètre au Mali pour jeter des lumières sur les espoirs de maintenir la démocratie, les marchés et les états dans les pays pauvres. snippet.title: A political analysis of decentralisation: coopting the Tuareg threat in Mali
snippet.description: The decentralisation programme in Mali received a boost when municipal elections were finally held in 1998â99. This programme, initiated in 1992, is notable for its scope and the degree of autonomy extended to rural and urban communes. Given Mali's history of failed attempts at decentralisation, the current administration's commitment to the programme suggests that political motives are driving the reform.
